intro: Gnaphalium septentrionale, commonly known as the northern cudweed, is a flowering plant native to northern regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has a low-growing habit with slender stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellowish-green and produce tiny seeds that are dispersed by the wind.
